long_cite: Ward, C.D. & Cooper, R.P. (1999) A lack of evidence in 4‐month‐old human infants for paternal voice preference. Developmental Psychobiology, 35, 49-59
criterion_definition: at least two looks less than two seconds in duration
exclusionCriteria: crying_9|at least two looks less than two seconds_4|failure to look at the display_2|experiment failure_4
speaker: Familiar father
Coder 1 Comments: audio recording made in home; all infants did 2 different conditions, couterbalanced
Coder 2 Comments: MZ: coding crosses Experiment 1 (ADS, own vs. unfamiliar father) and Experiment 2 (IDS, own vs. unfamiliar father); direction of effect (means, sds) was prreviously incorrect and needed to be switched (looking times for Experiment 2/ IDS are generally lower); criterion column misinterpreted - should be objective criteria for exclusion (in Exp 2: at least two looks with less than 2s looking), not trial termination; age range is not available in the data (removed); for general exclusion columns, must combine across groups (previously only exclusions from group 1 were described in more detail); no infants explicitly described as fussers, thus coded this column as NA; age range is three weeks according to tables 1/ 2
Coder 3 comments: Data comparisson across experiments: ADS exp 1 vs IDS exp2. There are different groups for each experiment which makes the coding a between comparisson. Most data seem correctly coded. 2 changes made: Number of exclusions and gender proportion data was inverted (e.g. ADS data was coded as exp1 and IDS data as exp2) this was fixed.

long_cite: Ostroff, W. L. (1998) The perceptual draw of prosody: Infant-directed speech within the context of declining nonnative phoneme perception. Master's Thesis. Virginia Tech.
speaker: Unfamiliar mother
Coder 1 Comments: Recordings were parents talking to their own child, or adult, and the recording were used for randomly assigned particpants.
Coder 2 Comments: MZ: test_lang is coded as other, because ADS was native and IDS was nonn-native. speaker_experience is a bit unclear for ADS - only "female" is specified, not nnecessarily caregiver experience; an "effect size" is reported as 0.42 - circumstantial evidence and the description in the text suggests this is Cohen's d, but not 100% explicit in the text - coded as d; removed one row previously added that also included analyses when removing the first trial (robustness check, shouldn't really be included as a separate row/ estimate)

long_cite: Jusczyk, P. W., Hirsh-Pasek, K., Nelson, D. G. K., Kennedy, L. J., Woodward, A., Piwoz, J. (1992). Perception of Acoustic Correlates of Major Phrasal Units by Young Infants. Cognitive Psychology, 24 (2), 252-293.
criterion_definition: failure to look to one of the two sides for at least three test trials
exclusionCriteria: failure to look to one of the two sides for at least three test trials_18|crying_11|experimenter error_1
speaker: Unfamiliar mother
Coder 2 Comments: Made a bunch of corrections on 2021-03-21; MZ: confirmed 4/1/2021; decision here is to use the t-statistic where an overall comparison is made between the IDS and ADS groups (DV is difference in overall looking time between the two within-subjects conditions, coincident vs. non-coincident); speaker is implied to have experience, be a mother (though this is not entirely explicit); marked fussers as NA because no infants were explicitly described as being excluded for "fussiness"; split n_excluded across the two groups evenly; added the "failure to look to one of the two sides" criterion explicitly; my understanding is that there is actually a familiarization to the stimuli prior to the test (see description of Exp 1) - coded exposure_phase accordingly
